indications:
Indications prophylaxis and long-term treatment of chronic or recurrent lower
urinary-tract infections
name: METHENAMINE HIPPURATE
cautions:
Cautions avoid concurrent administration with sulfonamides
(risk of crystalluria) or urinary alkalinising agents; interactions: Appendix 1 (methenamine)
side-effects:
Side-effects gastro-intestinal disturbances, bladder irritation,
rash
doses:
1 g every 12 hours (may be increased in patients with
catheters to 1 g every 8 hours); child 6–12 years 500 mg every 12 hours
